MaleStrings.String: Trip Mine
We can access the beacon now.
I'm at the control panel, Commander. Cerberus set up a firewall around the trigger mechanism to slow us down.
I know what's at stake, Commander.
We'll make sure you have the time you need, Lieutenant.
I put my team at risk to get you here, Lieutenant. You better deliver.
We have your back.
Don't screw this up.
We're getting heavy resistance here!
Entrance sighted! We're on the move!
He never hesitated.
Whatever he was before, he'll be remembered for this.
Hard to say. Sacrifice in war is expected. He did us proud, but... we're a hard bunch to please.
Living your life for the cause, society first, platoon first. It's all just expected.
Yes. Yes, he did.
You can spend your whole life making up for your mistakes...
He did his platoon proud in the end. That's good enough for any soldier.
He made mistakes. But he died a soldier.
I can't count the times I've watched friends risk everything for a cause.
Lieutenant Victus fought for a cause he believed in. A soldier can't ask for more than that. He died well.
Readings indicate the explosion caused only minor structural damage, Commander.
What will the primarch say?
What will the turians think about this, Garrus?
He did what he had to do when it counted.
There's a better vantage point up that ramp, Shepard!
Cover me!
Come on, come on.
No!
{Grunts}
Victory... at any cost.
Lieutenant!
Commander! Firewall's down! I'm in!
No time!
Disarm it!
The turians had already won the war against the krogan.
Planting a bomb that threatens their homeworld is unforgivable.
We defeat the krogan and then plant a bomb on their planet.
Pretty extreme, but those were desperate times.
The turians must have feared the krogan to plant such a weapon.
Damn, that bomb must be huge.
They sent a lot of guys to defend that thing.
The Krogan Rebellions were before my time, but I can't comprehend the need for this.
We were lucky to get through that gauntlet in one piece.
Cerberus is really dug in.
Cerberus is dug in, Commander.
Getting to that bomb will be hell.
Soldier
Adept
Out by the skin of our teeth again, hey Shepard?
I was afraid we wouldn't get anyone out alive, but because of you, we got almost everyone. Thank you.
Without a doubt... I'm at your service.
Of course. But I wouldn't mind staying with these folks.
And I'm sure you can count on the others as well.
I have a feeling you'll do all right, Shepard.
You know, Commander, I've never met anyone like you. Just feel better knowing you're on our side.
Shepard, when this mess is over, drinks are on me. Be safe out there.
Nice to see you back in action.
Dr. Cole, I have a request--one that you can't afford to turn down.
And now there's something you can do for me.
I need your help against the Reapers.
You too, Jacob. I need you.
Keep them safe, then. The Alliance needs that Crucible.
All right. Report to Admiral Hackett for your assignment.
Thanks.
I understand.
Engineer
Infiltrator
Vanguard
Sentinel
Joker
Yes. Hostile geth fighter squadrons are networked to this server.
This is it?
I'm ready when you are.
Shepard, take a look at this.
Shepard, take a look at this.
That doctor in the vid was in a restricted zone.
Who is she?
Is she someone important?
We only met once. I got the distinct impression she didn't want to be friends.
Maybe. She couldn't have done it alone.
I don't like her already. Think she had something to do with this?
No! Not unless you want to decompress this room, too.
I don't see anyone...
Come on. There's no one alive in there. Let's keep moving.
Initiating peer-network integration. Proceed to docking port.
Let's do it.
Your attention.
You...
You killed the scientists... What do you want?
Remember that--because here they come.
On that building! We've got fire support!
No--damn them!
Keep your focus, Liara.
Watch your head!
Scan complete. It is a manifestation of the Old Machines.
Yes, contact is hazardous. We will provide combat software.
We have noted your affinity for firearms.
We wish to provide familiar equipment.
A gun?
Straight ahead and around the corner--past the first barricade.
Soldier! Which way to your commanding officer?
The enemy has a single purpose: to devour.
Allies become the enemy, family becomes foe.
If you are not ready to destroy your own kind, you will lose.
Now that you're here? As long as it takes!
Can you really win this war?
Then grab some gear over there if you need it and let's do some damage!
Got one!
Outpost Tykis isn't far from here. I can cover you!
Another hit!
Get going, Commander! This whole sector is about to collapse!
How long can you hold out?
We get to that temple, and the Reapers are history.
We're after a relic inside the temple. It's important.
I'm looking for an artifact.
Shepard.
Show yourself. I promise I won't miss.
Stick to your talents, Dr. T'Soni. You've helped uncover the key to subjugating the Reapers.
And then bring me the data.
Understood.
How did you find this place?
Or destroying them.
Commander Shepard, is that you?
Commander?
We've lost all contact with Thessia... the planet has gone dark.
How soon will the Crucible be ready to deploy?
What happened?
I... don't know what to say.
What was the situation on Thessia?
Then you'll excuse me. There are... preparations to make... continuity of civilization to consider...
I never thought this day would come.
Councilor, the mission--
Councilor... I wish the news was better. We didn't get the information.
Cerberus was there. We were...
We were defeated. We don't know how to finish the Crucible.
Deteriorating fast. The Reapers are there in strength.
None of us did. I'm...
...sorry.
The mission's looking really dicey.
Asari Scientists
Lieutenant Victus
Admiral Gerrel here. We've got them on the run. Just hold tight.
Admiral Gerrel here. That planetary defense cannon is tearing us up. I'll send in what I can.
Admiral Gerrel here. We had to fall back to protect the liveships. I'll send in what I can.
Admiral Gerrel here. We're taking heavy losses. I'll send in what I can spare.
Shepard to Fleet: It's not a Reaper base! It's a live Reaper! I need an orbital strike!
Here.
They're asari. We might be able to reach them.
Commander!
I was listening over the radio. If Han'Gerrel hadn't stopped--
Admiral Raan. I heard your ship made a crash-landing. Glad you got out in one piece.
He did.
Primarch Fedorian is dead. His shuttle was shot down an hour ago as it tried to leave the moon.
The turian hierarchy provides very clear lines of succession.
So what happens now?
Right. General Corinthus?
Leng, the Commander has something I need.
Duration: lasts until overridden by another ammo power Fire Damage: {Damage%p}% of base weapon damage ({Damage%f}% bonus)
We have made ourselves visually distinct for your convenience.
You look... different.
Commander!
Focus on the bomb! We'll handle Cerberus.
I need more time, Commander!
Keep them off me!
Door
Open
Get ready! I've almost got the door.
Incoming!

Recharge Time: {CooldownTime} seconds ({CooldownTime%f}% bonus) Duration: {EffectDuration} seconds ({EffectDuration%f}% bonus) Health Bonus: +{HealthBonus%p}% of maximum health Shield Bonus: +{ShieldBonus%p}% of maximum shields
Scientist
Commander, I've got radio chatter coming in from krogan forces planetside.
Sounds like they started sweeping out the remaining Cerberus troops. Hate to be the guy who told the krogan about that surprise package.
You get out all right? Sounds like it got ugly down there.
Understood, Commander. Joker out.
The turians took a lot of casualties, Joker. The primarch's son included.
Nobody dies well. I'm tired of saying otherwise.
More damage was done than that, EDI.
His son gave his life to get the job done. That's all that matters.
Due to restricted resources, it is best if you connect alone.
Geth no longer reside on this server. We may now exit the consensus.
You must proceed to the exit port and disconnect--
What's happening?
How are we doing?

Yes.
Ah, Commander, I know who you are. I can't wait to find out what brings you out here.
General Victus?
I'm Commander Shepard of the Normandy.
Geth Pulse Rifle
M-96 Mattock <CUSTOM0>
New Assault Rifle #1
New Assault Rifle #2
New SMG #1
New SMG #2
And with Cerberus coming for my students, I need the best.
Agreed, but the Alliance needs every resource it can get, and our students are unique... resources.
They wanted to help. How could we say no with the entire galaxy falling apart?
I just wish it was from somewhere else.
But you're right, the Alliance needs help. And God bless them, some of our older students volunteered.
Hang on. I've been trying to get communications working.
This is Froeberg! There are students trapped in Orion Hall! Cerberus has us boxed in. They're closing fast!
Damn it.
Thank you, Commander. I'll stay put. With luck, I can regain control of some of our systems.
A few months knocking over practice dummies can't prepare your students for war.
We need all the help we can get.
I'll bring them back here, and we'll make a run for the shuttle.
That's dangerous for students.
Good. We can use them.

The asari have been down this road before, Commander Shepard.
And I'm sure you understand that we cannot afford to waste time with the Reapers knocking at our door.
I tried to smooth things over with the salarian dalatrass. To say she's upset would be a monumental understatement.
But Madame Councilor, let me--
No New Messages
There are no new messages.

Liara, do you have anything more on this artifact?

Cerberus troops are trying to get in.
We are not Legion.
One node remains. We are currently--
Hang on.
Legion?
Legion? Talk to me.
Just give me the update.
What's wrong?
This area houses data pertaining to the initial geth-creator conflict on Rannoch. The Morning War.
What's this place?
Shutting down this node. Loading back into the main hub.
Krogan Corpse
Sweep the classrooms. There are still students on the station.
All units be advised, we have Alliance soldiers on the station.
One of our instructors is with them, but they can't hold out much longer.
They're exhausted. They can't hold out much longer.
Getting paid to fly circles around Cerberus? Yeah, I could do this for a living.
Joker, we're still trying to reach the students. How are you holding up?
Grunt
Dagg
The infection has located our network packets.
What's happening?
Reinforced Door
Weapon upgrade acquired
Customize weapons at mod stations
Take
Ashley
Kaidan
Force Open
Damaged Door
All right! All right, bring it on!
I see the comm tower... to the left of the main barricade. In front of Palaven.
Let's go!
Damn, that poor guy back there never saw it coming.
Let's take it to these Reaper bastards!
Kahlee said she was putting out an SOS. I had no idea the Queen of the Girl Scouts would show up.
All right, amp check! Prangley, those fields were weak. Cerberus isn't gonna lie down out of pity like that girl you took to prom.
Grab juice and an energy bar. We move in five.
As charming as ever...
Jack's personality appears largely unchanged.
Anger. Good. We can use that.
Okay. Right now, all I care about is getting my guys out of here.
Yes.
It was highly significant. You were the first organic to openly cooperate with geth since the end of the Morning War.
We wish to ensure you are not the last.
Legion? That's back when I activated you on the Normandy.
You've been thinking about when we met?
What happened with the machines?
Geth fighters have been disabled. Any remaining squadrons attacking the liveships have withdrawn. The server is offline.
We have transferred geth programs from the server into these platforms.
They wish to join us.
Did it work?
Are you sure?
What's happening?
Why?
Assault Trooper
Centurion
Guardian
Atlas
Titan
Phantom
Combat Engineer
Nemesis
Turret
Getting bounced around pretty bad.
It was planted centuries ago, after the Krogan Rebellions. The bomb was a safeguard against another galactic war.
This is as close as we get, Lieutenant. Look for somewhere to set your platoon down.
Where is it?
Acknowledged.
We'll shadow you from the second level and hit those fu... those guys from above.
I like it. Keeps them safer, too.
A good strategy that protects the students from direct fire.
Gives them some cover, too.
It would keep the students out of direct fire.
A useful tactic. They would avoid direct fire.
Students of Grissom Academy, the station is sealed. The Alliance soldiers cannot save you.
All they can do is get you killed. Surrender peacefully, and you won't be harmed.
Asshole.
What if... what if they're not lying?
What? You see the scars, Rodriguez? Come on, take a good look. Cerberus did this to me when I was half your age.
Surrender and you're meat on a slab. We're trying to save your asses.
Commander Shepard isn't going to let anything happen to us!
Yeah. Yeah, okay.
Everyone be ready. We'll go in first and draw their fire.
All right, everyone. Hit them with everything you've got.
You've already held your own against Cerberus.
You've been trained for this by one of the best.
I've seen firsthand what Cerberus does to people they promised not to harm.
Let's go.
Do some damage.
You can do this.
They're lying.
The psychotic biotic!
"I will destroy you!"
Drink your juice, Rodriguez. You couldn't destroy wet tissue paper.
Yeah, yeah. Whenever you've got a way out of here, my guys will be ready to move.
Good.
What's so valuable about these students? Biotically, I mean.
How are the students handling the war?
I have to say, Jack, you look good.
So about you and me...
I'm glad we got the chance to talk.
Stay close. We'll get you out of here.
Biotic squad
Your students and war
The new you
Us
Good talking to you.
Goodbye.
Shepard?
Everyone, get down! This thing's outta your league! Shepard, keep it off us!
Jack?
Commander, it might be better if we follow along from the second level.
You can take point while we hit them from above.
Don't listen to him! He's just messing with your heads!
You've all been trained for this.
Well, what's scarier than a pissed-off biotic attacker? A whole bunch of them working together.
It's like a biotic artillery strike. Any asshole gets in our way, we rip 'em to shreds.
Yeah, sure. But we've been working on conditioning, improving endurance.
Whenever they complain, I tell them about the Collector base. Throwing husks around, making shockwaves all over the place...
I kept thinking, "Damn, let the salarian handle this! He can talk 'em to death."
Yeah? Too bad. He had some wicked sex advice.
You know damn well it wasn't! Cerberus was torturing kids on Pragia!
These guys are older, and they volunteered. And the only ones feeling any pain are the bad guys.
How do you think? They're a bunch of teenagers.
Until a few months ago, their biggest concern was getting laid.
I don't think they have a choice.
Save it for shore leave, big guy.
What, you wanna pin me against the wall in the subdeck again?
Yeah, well... maybe some of your attitude rubbed off on me.
I never had a family. And these guys...
Hey, I get it. You've only got one real love in your life. The Reapers. They're the only thing keeping you awake at night.
Which is too bad...
...because I'm a much better lay.
Doesn't that exhaust them?
I saw Mordin. He's dead.
Isn't that the kind of thing you wanted to destroy on Pragia?
You don't think they're ready for war?
That's not what I meant.
Do they get tired?
Like on Pragia?
Anyone screws with my students, I will tear them apart.
Classified mission, and Victus sends his son? Interesting.
The primarch sends his son on a classified mission? That's interesting.
Legion, give me an update.
Asari Intelligence
Prothean
Thanks. Cerberus hasn't given us time to catch our breath.
This is Ensign Rodriguez. I'm Ensign Prangley.
Our commander was, um...
I guess I'm in charge, sir.
Okay. We need a bit to recharge, though.
They've been after us for hours. We've burned close to a thousand calories, and...
Respectfully, Commander, it doesn't work that way. We've burned close to a thousand calories in the last few hours.
We need to rest and get some food in our systems.
He's right, Shepard. After a fight like that, I'd be exhausted.
He is correct. They are exhausted. Useless in a fight.
Okay, guys! Grab a quick bite and check your amps for damage. We move in five.
Commander, I was wondering...
Does it ever get easier?
We're here to get you off the station. I'm Commander Shepard.
Who's in charge, Prangley?
Ensign, you've done a hell of job holding out like this. Now we're getting you out of here.
It's okay. How long do you need?
No room for guesswork, Ensign. You're in charge of these recruits. Get them ready and on their feet.
All right, Prangley. You're in charge. How long do you need?
I'd be worried if it didn't bother you, but you're doing the right thing here.
No.
I'm here to help.
Officers don't guess.
It has to stay with you.
Shepard-Commander? You may proceed to the first node to begin disconnecting the server.
You will encounter it within the nodes. We reiterate a need for caution.
Infection programs are increasing. We have restabilized. You must continue.
What about that Reaper infection?
Got it.
Wasn't about to get cozy with it.
So many lives given...
I don't think they gave, doc. I think they got taken.
I am capturing images of the deceased. It may prove useful for motivating resistance or inclusion in future memorials.
The humans have an expression, EDI: "It's too soon.'"
In our cycle, factions also turned on each other. The Reapers used them to spread fear.
Do not be afraid, asari. It gives the Reapers one more weapon.
Man, what kind of effed-up ideology means you shoot cops? Is that like a recruiting tool for these sickos?
An attack on the Citadel could be reframed as a human-supremacist political goal. C-Sec could easily be demonized.
Their heavy turian membership and the Council's inaction in the face of Earth's Reaping means they can be classified as enemies.
They're telling their guys to wreck the Citadel for Earth's sake? That's some twisted shit.
Fear of annihilation propels a species to lash out. Scapegoats are easily created.
In our cycle, entire planets were lost because a few leaders were indoctrinated. They urged their armies to fight one another.
Well, it ain't gonna happen here.
Are you all right? Your body language indicates contemplation.
In my cycle, it is said the Reapers took this station in a matter of hours. To see its inhabitants fight back gives me pause.
You are welcome to share your feelings.
There is hope for those living now. There was none for my species. That is all.
The Council's elevator should be on your level. Get in there!
We've stopped.
The shuttle pad above Shalmar Plaza. Udina's with them.
Commander, we're up here!
There they are! Put 'em down!
Cerberus troops incoming!
Get ready! More on the way!
We've got more Cerberus troops inbound!
I'm gonna rip you in half!
Ha!
Rodriguez took one in the arm... because she didn't watch her barrier!
Ensign Rodriguez took a shot, but I think she'll be okay.
Everyone okay up there?
I didn't buy it from the last guy, and I've got no reason to buy it now.
The square root of 906.01 equals...
Hello, Commander Shepard.
Yes. He rescued me from Cerberus. Sent me here. He made it quiet.
He looks much healthier.
I remember you. The Normandy computer.
No apology is necessary.
He looks better.
I remember you. Normandy crew.
Sorry.
It was never your fault.
Yes. I've been counting.
The number of days you lengthened my life.
The security office. I hacked the lock.
Guns. Lots of guns. Goodbye.
Okay. Uh, thanks.
I'm Commander Shepard with the Alliance. I'm here to help.
Sanders, this is Shepard. I've got some scared students hiding behind a shield prototype.
We don't have time for this.
Has Grissom Academy been all right?
Anything in particular?
Care to do the honors?
Liara?
EDI?
Garrus?
[Contact Kahlee Sanders]
[Destroy the shield]
Are you okay?
Mission success depends on acquiring the high-priority targets alive!
Why have we lost video? Get me back on that damn screen!
Hot targets in Orion Hall. Limited use of lethal force authorized.
All units converge on the Atrium!
Students on the upper tier!
Nonlethal force! These are high-priority targets!
Someone take out those damned biotics!
Lethal force authorized! We are not going back to command empty-handed!
Sure, Garrus, it's ugly.
But it's a hell of a lot better than another galactic war.
While morally questionable, the strategy is sound.
After all this, to lose everything in a flash.
Yeah, galactic war might put me in a bad mood, too.
They did what they had to.
Maybe the turians have more in common with us than I thought.
A cunning strategy: control your enemies without them knowing it.
Extreme? It's monstrous.
Sure, Tali, it's ugly.
You're right, Tali.
Wasn't just the turians. It was everybody. The krogan had to be put down.
No one wanted another galactic war... but planting a bomb on Tuchanka?
Cerberus doesn't fool around, Lieutenant.
And bombs don't have to be very big. Trust me.
The size is due to heavy shielding needed to ensure the bomb remains intact.
Bombs don't have to be big, Lieutenant. Trust me.
It means war between the turians and the krogan.
Cerberus will stop at nothing to detonate it.
You've been in battles, Liara, never a war. War changes the definition of "monstrous."
Look at it! How did they hide that thing?
Hard to imagine. All these years, and no one found that.
I can't believe it remained undetected for so long.
Damn!
A planet-killer hidden under the ruins.
There it is. Amazing no one detected it, even in all this.
That's a lot of explosives to remain undetected.
An explosive that large could generate extensive damage.
It must have been strategically placed for maximum yield.
An effective way to deal with an enemy. The turians who created this have my respect.
We have to stop them.
We better hurry.
That's an incredibly powerful bomb. Potentially unstable as well, given its age.
We better get over there.
It must have been far enough underground to stay hidden. Cerberus had to dig it out.
Shepard! What happened in there?
Shepard? How do you feel?
Shepard! You all right?
Shepard! Are you hurt?
Commander! You okay?
I'm getting a lot of Cerberus radio chatter.
They're prepping for evac.
I don't like the sound of that.
Once we reach the bomb, I'll need to reprogram the trigger mechanism.
Copy that. No trigger, no explosion.
Bosh'tet!
Careful!
Watch it!
Watch it!
Close one!
Your ears ringing too?
Forward!
Watch it!
Come on!
Forward!
Damn it!
Look out!
Look out!
Look out!

The Reaper plasma-based semi-automatic assault rifle has a high rate of fire, tremendous damage potential, and, because of its size, very strong recoil. A unique, bayonet-like apparatus allows the weapon to be used at close range.
Scorpion Pistol <CUSTOM0>

Originally issued to the salarian STG to allow small units to contain much larger enemy forces, the Scorpion pistol now sees service galaxy-wide. It fires low-velocity, squash-head projectiles with a dual use. The high-explosive filler within the projectiles contains an adhesive that secures the projectile to the target on impact. When fired into a surface, it turns into a proximity mine.
Pistol that fires adhesive explosives that can also be used as proximity mines.
M-25 Hornet <CUSTOM0>

The Hornet is a long-range submachine gun created by Cerberus. It is standard equipment for Cerberus troops, who are trained to handle the recoil from the gun's three-round bursts. Cerberus designed the Hornet to conserve ammunition and provide cover-fire during prolonged conflicts.
Long-range submachine gun that fires 3-round bursts.
M-358 Talon <CUSTOM0>

The Talon is a close-range pistol favored by Cerberus Guardians. Firing heavy-gauge shotgun pellets, it delivers massive trauma to unarmored targets. Its waste heat is sufficiently excessive that it carries six separate ammunition blocks, rotating like a twentieth-century revolver to prevent shaver jam or misfire due to premature melting of the shot.
Shotgun-pistol hybrid, effective at close range.
Arc Pistol <CUSTOM0>

An innovation of Admiral Daro'Xen, the Arc Pistol is a scaled-down Arc Projector that only requires thermal clips, to solve its power problems. The Arc Pistol uses a nonvisible laser to ionize the air and create a path for a high-ampere electric shock. For a more damaging blast, it can be charged up.
Electrical weapon that can be charged up for a more damaging blast.
Graal Spike Thrower <CUSTOM0>

The Graal is one of a long line of krogan weapons used to hunt thresher maws. Its ammunition consists of oversized flechettes meant to pierce thresher hide and create deep wound channels leading to massive blood loss. For additional firepower, the weapon is double-barreled, and, as a last resort, possesses blades to cause internal injuries if the wielder is swallowed by the thresher. Using a Graal on a humanoid target has predictably grisly effects. Its shots can be charged for more damage.
Krogan weapon that causes blood loss damage over time. Can be charged for more damage.
Centurion
Powerful shotgun. Very short ranged, but high stopping power.
M-13 Raptor <CUSTOM0>

The Raptor is a human version of a turian weapon developed for conflict on the low-gravity world Amar. Fighting at longer ranges than expected, the turians optimized a low-recoil, semi-automatic rifle with a scope, and issued it to their regular infantry, creating a hybrid weapon that was half-assault rifle and half-sniper weapon. Cerberus assigns the Raptor to Nemesis snipers.
Hybrid of an assault rifle and a sniper rifle with semi-automatic fire and low recoil.
Javelin <CUSTOM0>

Called the Javelin by Alliance marines, this geth weapon holds a reservoir of ferrofluid, magnetically drawn into the firing chamber and expelled at lethal speeds. Like a high-pressure water-jet, the ferrofluid cuts through nearly anything it hits with so much heat that it resembles a beam of light, causing terrible wounds .
Geth sniper rifle with thermal imaging that allows firing through walls.

Geth Plasma Shotgun <CUSTOM0>

This three-barreled geth weapon fires miniature but potent cluster rounds of superconducting projectiles and has a longer range than standard shotguns. A two-stage trigger system allows for either quick-fire capacitors or a charge-and-release attack to electrify the projectiles as they exit the weapon. As the rounds hit the target, they fragment and electricity arcs between the pieces, flash-converting the air to conductive plasma. A mass-accelerator heavy weapon, the Havoc projects large, concentrated bursts of kinetic energy that slam into groups of enemies, flinging them across the battlefield. Recently created by the Alliance, this experimental gun is popular with resistance forces on Earth: the Havoc's burst effect means a single soldier can fend off entire crowds with judiciously timed shots.

After the carnage of the Battle of the Citadel, Alliance officers commissioned a new rifle for their ground forces. A variation of the popular Avenger design, the Valkyrie is now standard issue for new recruits. Exceptionally well-crafted, accurate, and packing ample firepower, the rifle is a hot black-market item when it surfaces.

The Argus is a high-powered rifle favored by senior C-Sec officers. An excellent close-range weapon, its bursts of fire ensure ammunition conservation during lengthy conflicts. Other law-enforcement agencies across the galaxy are adopting the Argus as their standard rifle, as much for its intimidation factor as its suppression power.

While some militaries pass on the Hurricane because of its lower accuracy, the Alliance feels the gun's rapid firing rate offers excellent suppressive fire. A disciplined marksman can use the fully automatic submachine gun to chew through targets with alarming speed. Alliance officers were so pleased with field results that the Hurricane is now many squadrons' standard-issue SMG.

Carried by the batarian military's notorious Special Intervention Unit, the Raider is a semi-automatic shotgun that loads slowly but fires rapidly, with tremendous force. Short-range even for a shotgun, the Raider has a large pellet spread. Rather than eliminating recoil, its integral compensators instead make it predictable and vertical.

Bruised and bloody Alliance marines on Torfan attributed their survival against waves of batarian mercenaries to the precision and stopping power of the Crusader. With a design patterned on riot shotguns, this weapon has a moderate rate of fire that rewards careful aiming. Since this accuracy requires little room for error, the Crusader is primarily used by highly trained soldiers.

The Indra's low-powered scope leaves it most effective at medium range, but many soldiers believe this limitation is offset by the gun's rapid rate of fire. The Indra is the first military-grade, fully automatic sniper rifle. It has an extremely efficient heat-sink system that allows a surprisingly large number of shots to be fired before the weapon ejects its thermal clip.

The Valiant is a sniper rifle tested by Alliance soldiers during a series of harsh survival exercises on the planet Kruljaven. This streamlined weapon employs a sophisticated fire-control system that improves accuracy by stabilizing the barrel during targeting. Although this comes at the cost of reduced capacity and rate of fire, most soldiers find the increase in precision and quick reloading time a worthy tradeoff.
They're getting closer!
